drug.name: Chlorproguanil
drug.description: Chlorproguanil has been used in trials studying the treatment of MALARIA. It is a dichloro-derivative of chloroguanide.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as dichlorobenzenes. These are compounds containing a benzene with exactly two chlorine atoms attached to it.

drug-interaction.name: Artemether
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Chlorproguanil is combined with Artemether.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of QTc prolongation can be increased when Chlorproguanil is combined with Lumefantrine.
